page.title: 11PARSONAGE FARM, MARSH BALDON
page.content: Peter and Nancy Delafield rent 800 acres from Queens College; a farmer for 40 years, he has been in Marsh Baldon for 14 years. The farm is mainly arable, fattening calves during winter for spring sale. He employs 4, including his son. His day is mainly supervisory, sharing his time with his farm in Cassington. His day is 7a.m.-5p.m.(10p.m. in summer). Office work averages 6 hours a week. A secretary works one day weekly. Maize silage is made for beef cattle. Last year 120 tons of hay was collected from the Green. They raise pheasants and the shoot is syndicated. One son and two daughters live at home. Both daughters are successful horsewomen. On the farm are 9 horses, 2 cats and 2 dogs. The farmhouse is 400 years old. Mr. Delafield is in the C.L.A.and N.F.U
